data.title: Wilhelm Roetgen Discovers the X-Ray
data.meta_description: Johnson & Johnson Our Story explores the remarkable people, ideas, and products that have shaped Johnson & Johnson into one of the world’s most innovative healthcare companies.
data.text:
Image courtesy: Johnson & Johnson Archives

The accidental discovery of the X-ray won German scientist Wilhelm Roentgen the world’s first Nobel Prize in physics. The X-ray machine was built within weeks of Roentgen’s announcement. It allowed doctors and scientists to see inside the body for the first time, without putting patients under the knife. Roentgen’s invention was particularly helpful in times of war to help surgeons locate bullets and broken bones.
